NeuralNetwork

Class NeuralNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • NeuralNetwork.NeuralNetwork

  • public class NeuralNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a neural network containing one input layer with 3 inputs, two hidden layer with a variable number of neurons and one output layer containing a variable amount of output neurons (depending on how many colors are to be detected).

    This project was created for the ROB[SP17] course in an attempt to better differentiate colors when using the E-puck camera.

    Note:The external libraries used are JAMA, which provides basic linear algebra functions and apache-commons-cli for the CLI argument parser. In this project, JAMA is mostly used to store information in matrices, which makes the calculations more readable. (Initially, I planned to implement a batch learning version, but I lost the overview when implementing the back-propagation algorithm). In a batch version, Matrix operations enables much more elegant code.

    Network type: FFANN (Feed forward artificial neural network)
    Learning Algorithm: SGD (Stochastic gradient descent)
    Learning type: Supervised

    Note: It is not advised to train in simulation or trying to test in simulation.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nicolas Dutly

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNetwork

        public NeuralNetwork(int nbOfHiddenNeurons,
                     int nbOfColors)
        Create a neural network with the following topology: Input Layer: 3 input nodes (R/G/B) + bias 2 hidden Layer with a variable amount of neurons (-n flag) Output Layer: variable amount of neurons (-c flag)
        Parameters:
        nbOfHiddenNeurons - specifies the number of hidden layer neurons
        nbOfColors - specifies how many colors are to be recognized

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public double[] query(boolean normalized,
                      double red,
                      double green,
                      double blue)
        Queries the neural network using following parameters
        Parameters:
        normalized - indicates whether the passed values are already normalized
        red - the red rgb value [0-255]
        green - the green rgb value [0-255]
        blue - the blue rgb value [0-255]
        Returns:
        the output array where the first element is the red probability, green the second and blue the third. (Note that array positions might change if the training color order is swapped parseDataSets(String, String, String))

      • init

        public void init(int nbOfEpochs)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Trains, validates and tests the neural network.
        Parameters:
        nbOfEpochs - number of cycles that the training matrix is to be fed through the network.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the training input matrix is null.
        See Also:
        train(), validate(), test(), write_statistics(int, int)

      • printProgress

        private void printProgress(int nbOfEpochs,
                           int currentEpoch)
        Print the current training progress percentage
        Parameters:
        nbOfEpochs - total number of epochs
        currentEpoch - elapsed epochs

      • test

        private void test()
        Tests the network performance under realistic circumstances.

        Testing takes place at the very end of the program, only if a testing set is provided. A training set consists of data not present in training and validation sets. The data present in the testing set is passed through the network. The result gives an indication of the overall network performance.

      • write_statistics

        private void write_statistics(int currentEpoch,
                              int nbOfEpochs)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes network error statistics to stats/err_writer.csv (percentage of false classifications)
        Parameters:
        currentEpoch - the current epoch
        nbOfEpochs - total number of epochs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on IO exception when accessing stats/error_stats.csv

      • validate

        private void validate()
        Validates the network output by using a validation set

        Validation only takes place if a validation set is provided. A validation set consists of data not present in the training set. When used in conjunction with the (-s) flag, allows to compare the training and validation error. If the number of epochs is to high or if the amount of neurons in the hidden layers is to high, overfitting will occur (the validation error will increase while the training error decreases). This loss of generalisation can be avoided by observing the network statistics and reducing the number of epochs and/or hidden layer neurons.

        Note that no backpropagation takes place.

        See Also:
        init(int)

      • train

        private void train()
        Feeds a the training set through the neural network, then back-propagates the error and adjusts the weights. Called once during every epoch.
        See Also:
        init(int)

      • parseDataSets

        public void parseDataSets(java.lang.String trainingSet,
                          java.lang.String validationSet,
                          java.lang.String testingSet)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses a csv file, which is in following format:
        r,g,b;x1,x2,x3,...,xn
        With one of the xi set to one. Where
        r: red value [0-255]
        g: green value [0-255]
        b: blue value [0-255]
        x1: set to 1 if color is red
        x2: set to 1 if color is green
        x3: set to 1 if color is blue
        (Note: the order of the xi can be interchanged, this will result in a change of the output vector write_C_source(String)) The csv values are then inserted into the following Matrices
        Note:The first line of the testing set *must* contain the names of the colors to that are to be recognized, in the correct order and separated by commas (see testing set example) trainingInput trainingOutput validationInput validationOutput testingInput testingOutput
        Parameters:
        trainingSet - csv file path of the training set
        validationSet - csv file path of the validation set (optional)
        testingSet - csv file path of the testing set (optional)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO exception occurs
        java.lang.Exception - if the csv file has an incorrect format.

      • write_C_source

        public void write_C_source(java.lang.String filename)
        Prints out the query formula for the neural network in a c file that can then be compiled with the other project files and can be run independently from the java program.
        Parameters:
        filename - the c source file to write to.

      • setWriteStats

        public void setWriteStats(boolean writeStats)
        Setter for writeStats
        Parameters:
        writeStats - set to true if error stats are to be written to stats/err_writer.csv

      • getFinalTrainingErr

        public double getFinalTrainingErr()
        Returns:
        final training classification (% of missed classifications over the entire training set)

      • getFinalValidationErr

        public double getFinalValidationErr()
        Returns:
        final training classification (% of missed classifications over the entire validation set)
